meanings.definition: In a manner that is incapable of making mistakes or being wrong.
meanings.sent1: She followed the recipe infallibly, never making a single mistake.
meanings.sent2: The GPS system infallibly guided us to our destination every time.
meanings.sent3: Even the robot chef cooked infallibly, never burning a dish.
meanings.sent4: His memory was like an infallibly accurate computer, never forgetting a detail.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beacon shone infallibly through the storm, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is always accurate or reliable.
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast was infallibly correct, predicting rain every afternoon.
meanings.sent2: The clock in the town square struck infallibly on the hour, never late.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller's predictions were infallibly accurate, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like an infallibly reliable compass, always pointing her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The old dog's sense of smell was infallibly sharp, leading him straight to the treat.
